definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: That the 32 points Kobe Bryant hung on them three days earlier would have been convincing enough.
sentences.chinese: 三天前拿下32分的科比已經令人心悅誠服了。

sentences.english: Finally, the other willingly left a pamphlet issued by Wang Chang-lock.
sentences.chinese: 最後，對方心悅誠服地留下了王長鎖發放的小冊子。

sentences.english: It only took a convincing patina of truth.
sentences.chinese: 只不過是令人心悅誠服的真相表層罷了。

sentences.english: Seeing his painting, we will be sincerely convinced.
sentences.chinese: 看了他的畫，我們會覺得心悅誠服。

sentences.english: There was about Jephson a hard, integrated earnestness which soon convinced Clyde.
sentences.chinese: 傑甫遜的堅決與認真立刻使克萊德心悅誠服。

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
see 眾星捧月|众星捧月[zhong4 xing1 peng3 yue4]
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
